qas.question: In what text is Shaivism recounted?
When was the text on Shaivism written?
Who reported the major schools of Shaivism?
How many major schools of Shaivism did Vidyaranya mention?
What is the Kashmir Shaivism mentioned by Vidyaranya?
What is easy to determine of Shaivism?
What philosophical school is Shaivism not represented by?

context: <b5_0>Early history<b5_0/> of Shaivism is difficult to determine. However, the <a0_0>Śvetāśvatara Upanishad<a0_0/> (<a1_0><b6_0>400 – 200 BCE<b6_0/><a1_0/>) is considered to be the earliest textual exposition of a systematic philosophy of Shaivism. Shaivism is represented by various philosophical schools, including non-dualist (<b8_0>abheda<b8_0/>), dualist (bheda), and non-dualist-with-dualist (bhedābheda) perspectives. <a2_0><b7_0><b9_0>Vidyaranya<b9_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/> in his works mentions <a3_0>three<a3_0/> major schools of Shaiva thought— Pashupata Shaivism, Shaiva Siddhanta and <a4_0>Pratyabhijña<a4_0/> (Kashmir Shaivism).
